title: How to Install Windows 95 With a Disk

steps.title: Insert the Windows 95 installation disk.
steps.content: Insert the Windows 95 installation disk.

steps.title: Type "Setup" and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Type "Setup" and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Wait for the screen message to appear.
steps.content: Wait for the screen message to appear. When this screen appears, press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Configure.
steps.content: Configure. If you haven't already allocated a partition to your hard drive, make sure 'Configure unallocated disk space' is highlighted and ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Select whether you would like large disk support.
steps.content: Select whether you would like large disk support. This is a matter of personal preference but 'Yes' was chosen in this tutorial. This message may not come up if your hard drive is smaller than 512mb.

steps.title: Ensure the Windows 95 Boot Disk is in Drive A and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Ensure the Windows 95 Boot Disk is in Drive A and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter to continue with the installation.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter to continue with the installation.

steps.title: Click Continue to continue with the installation.
steps.content: Click Continue to continue with the installation.

steps.title: Accept the license agreement.
steps.content: Accept the license agreement. It's a good idea to read the agreement so you know what you're agreeing to.

steps.title: Click Next
steps.content: Click Next

steps.title: Select where on your hard drive you want Windows 95 to install and click Next >.
steps.content: Select where on your hard drive you want Windows 95 to install and click Next > . Normally it is best to choose where Windows recommends.

steps.title: Select what kind of setup you would like and click Next >
steps.content: Select what kind of setup you would like and click Next > For this tutorial, 'Typical' was chosen.

steps.title: Type in your product key and click Next >
steps.content: Type in your product key and click Next > The product key should have come with your Windows 95 setup disks.

steps.title: Type in your name and click Next >.
steps.content: Type in your name and click Next > . It's not essential to put a company in

steps.title: If you have any of the hardware, click the check boxes which relate to your hardware and click Next >.
steps.content: If you have any of the hardware, click the check boxes which relate to your hardware and click Next > . For this tutorial, none of the check boxes were selected.

steps.title: Choose whether you want to install the most common components for Windows or to choose the components yourself and click Next >
steps.content: Choose whether you want to install the most common components for Windows or to choose the components yourself and click Next > For this tutorial, 'Install the most common components' was selected.

steps.title: Choose whether you want to create a startup disk or not and click Next >
steps.content: Choose whether you want to create a startup disk or not and click Next > The startup disk is a disk which can be inserted into your computer should Windows fail to boot and can then repair or reinstall Windows. For this tutorial 'No' was selected.

steps.title: Click Next
steps.content: Click Next

steps.title: Remove any disks from their drives e.g.
steps.content: Remove any disks from their drives e.g. floppy disks as well as the installation disk and click Finish

steps.title: If you get confronted with this error, please see Method 4 ' Fixing "Windows protection error"'
steps.content: If you get confronted with this error, please see Method 4 ' Fixing "Windows protection error"'

steps.title: Click OK
steps.content: Click OK

steps.title: Type in a Computer name and a Workgroup and click Close
steps.content: Type in a Computer name and a Workgroup and click Close Computer description is not required.

steps.title: Reinsert the Windows 95 installation disk and click OK
steps.content: Reinsert the Windows 95 installation disk and click OK

steps.title: Ensure your date and time settings are correct and then click Close
steps.content: Ensure your date and time settings are correct and then click Close

steps.title: Decide whether you want to install a printer.
steps.content: Decide whether you want to install a printer. If so click Next > otherwise choose Cancel ( Cancel was chosen in this tutorial).

steps.title: Remove any disks in your computer and click OK to restart your computer.
steps.content: Remove any disks in your computer and click OK to restart your computer.

steps.title: The Windows 95 installation is complete.
steps.content: The Windows 95 installation is complete. Enjoy.

steps.title: Click Start.
steps.content: Click Start .

steps.title: Click Shutdown
steps.content: Click Shutdown

steps.title: Ensure the 'Shut down the computer?'
steps.content: Ensure the 'Shut down the computer?' option is checked and then click Yes .

steps.title: Firstly, got to http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/141402-windows-95-21ghz-cpu-limit-broken/
steps.content: Firstly, got to http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/141402-windows-95-21ghz-cpu-limit-broken/

steps.title: Scroll down until you see FIX95CPU_V3_FINAL.ZIP and click this hyperlink to begin the download.
steps.content: Scroll down until you see FIX95CPU_V3_FINAL.ZIP and click this hyperlink to begin the download.

steps.title: Click the little arrow next to FIX95CPU_V3_FINAL.ZIP as shown in the picture and click Show in folder.
steps.content: Click the little arrow next to FIX95CPU_V3_FINAL.ZIP as shown in the picture and click Show in folder .

steps.title: Right click the folder, and extract using the default Windows service by click Extract All... to a destination of your choosing.
steps.content: Right click the folder, and extract using the default Windows service by click Extract All... to a destination of your choosing. You can also use a 3rd party program such as 7-Zip.

steps.title: Read the readme file so you can decide which file you need to use.
steps.content: Read the readme file so you can decide which file you need to use. For virtual machines either : Mount FIX95CPU.ISO to the virtual CD drive or Mount FIX95CPU.IMA to the virtual floppy disk drive If running on bare metal either : Burn FIX95CPU.ISO to a CD or Write FIX95CPU.EXE to a floppy disk

steps.title: Make sure the file you want to use is in the appropriate format (e.g.
steps.content: Make sure the file you want to use is in the appropriate format (e.g. a CD), insert it into your computer and boot the computer and press any key to continue when confronted with the message shown in the picture.

steps.title: Decide whether you want to read the readme by press Y for Yes or N for No.
steps.content: Decide whether you want to read the readme by press Y for Yes or N for No. No was selected here as the readme is exactly the same as the one in the zip folder.

steps.title: When confronted with this message, press any key to continue.
steps.content: When confronted with this message, press any key to continue. This will begin to fix the processor issues.

steps.title: Press any key to restart the computer and remove the 'CD' from the computer.
steps.content: Press any key to restart the computer and remove the 'CD' from the computer. If you don't remove the 'CD', it will begin an endless loop into this setup screen.
